title: Clutch Cable - Installation

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Ensure the steering is set to the straight ahead position.
Position the cable to the motorcycle following the same routing as noted during removal.
Attach the inner cable to the boss on the clutch actuating arm using a reversal of the removal process.
Refit the outer cable to the adjuster bracket at the clutch cover end.

body.name: Clutch Cable - adjust gbox end ciwp

body.body: Refit the cable retaining guides to the frame down tube.
Refit the cable retaining bracket to the headstock and using new fixings tighten to
Set the lever adjuster to a point where an equal adjustment is possible in both directions.
Set the adjuster bracket at the clutch cover end to give a preliminary setting of 2 - 3 mm of free play as measured at the lever.
Operate the clutch lever several times and recheck the amount of free play present.
Tighten the clutch adjuster bracket lock nut at the clutch cover end to
Set the final adjustment of the cable to give 1 - 2 mm of free play at the lever by turning the adjuster nut and lock nut at the lever end. Secure the setting with the knurled lock nut.

body.name: Clutch Cable - adjust handlebar end cinn_9 D Series.svg)
